page.title: 14Little Addington Greens
page.content: Little Addington has a village green that is situated near the church. This green is triangular shape and is about 400 square metres. The land was registed as common land in about 1975, but the ownership was disputed about 1 year later,by the owners of a house adjoining the green. The house owner threatened to fence in the land so it appeared to be his land,but then he went to build a porch at the front of the house,on common land. The parish council could have forced the porch to be taken down,but because of all the legal and paperwork effort required,the porch was left standing.A much larger piece of land,about 1200 square metres, that is adjacent to Dovecote Drive,was left and became overrun by weeds,when the bungalows were built in Dovecote Drive.
